author: Staff Reporter
text:
Lyricist Pa. Vijay exhorted plus students to not to let cinema distract them from their studies till their public exams are over.

Speaking at ‘Padikarkal,’ a motivational programme for plus two students organised at the Arunai Engineering College, Tiruvannamalai on Thursday, Mr. Vijay said that though he has no big regard for the current exam system, he wanted to underscore the fact that the very exam was going to decide the course of students’ life at very crucial stage that comes after plus two.

Writer Stalin Gunasekaran in his address asked students to study with confidence, involvement and happiness. He insisted that English was merely a language and familiarity with this language itself should not be considered knowledge. Film director Thamira urged the students to think socially and study ethical matters. He also said that students should understand what they study. Director Raju Murugan said certain things introduce sudden changes in the lives of people and Periyar E.V. Ramasamy’s speech and Subramania Bharathi’s poems brought in changes in him. Platform speaker Manikandan spoke.

“About 4,000 students from Vellore, Tiruvannamalai, Villupuram, Krishnagiri and Cuddalore attended the programme,” a release from the college said.

G. Mohankumar, Principal welcomed the gathering, V. Ramanathan, Director, Academics, proposed vote of thanks.
title: Plus II students told not to be distracted by cinema
